Psychological Assessment teaches students how to use, administer and interpret major psychological tests, including the Wechsler Intelligence and Memory scales and other tests used routinely to assess cognition. It also addresses issues in determining real and unusual differences in test scores and communication of assessment findings.


It is assumed that students will have covered topics to do with test validity and reliability in prior courses.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"17e6ee2fdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619ff","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Test administration vivas","assessment_type":{"label":"Performance","value":"performance"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"","description":"

All students need to meet the criterion of complete competency in test administration. This will be assessed individually. Individual WAISIV vivas to be organised after Week 4 and before Week 8. This is a pass/fail component. Students must demonstrate mastery of the test. Failure to pass this component will be considered a failure of the course.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"47e6ee2fdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619c1","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"03e6ee2fdbf99850eb6b147a3a96198e","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"WAISIV WMSIV marking report","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"50","description":"

This assessment has 3 components. For the first component students will be required to score a complete WAIS IV profile to be submitted in class on Week 5.  For the second component students will be required to score a complete WMS IV profile to be submitted in class on Week 7. For the third component students will be expected to write a professional report using the test results from the two earlier exercises and this will be submitted via Turnitin on Friday Week 9. No submissions will be accepted after 19/04/19 – any assignment submitted after this will not be marked and will receive a grade of 0.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"1be6ee2fdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619fb","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"47e6ee2fdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619c1","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"83e6ee2fdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619c4","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"dbe6ee2fdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619f8","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"3ae6ee2fdbf99850eb6b147a3a961989","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Examination","assessment_type":{"label":"Examination","value":"examination"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"50","description":"

There will be a 2-hour examination held on campus during the University examination period (time and location TBA). The examination will include three sets of short answer questions covering all course lecture and reading material. No student should organise travel during this period until the final examination schedule has been released and the date of the exam is known. Further details regarding the exact time and location of the exam will be released on myUNSW as they become available.

","erg":[],"campus":{"name":""}},"additional_information":"","study_level_tooltip":"Postgraduate: A level of study that leads to the award of a Graduate Certificate, Graduate Diploma, Masters Degree or Doctorate.","campus":"Sydney","study_level_single":{"label":"Postgraduate","value":"pgrd"},"code":"PSYC7204","attributes":[],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"PSYC7204 - Adult and Child Clinical Psychology 2","description":"

The course provides theoretical knowledge and practical skills in child and adult clinical psychology. The focus is on etiology, assessment, diagnosis, case conceptualisation, and empirically supported treatment of psychopathology in children and adults. These problems will be considered within the individual’s relevant social context (including family, school, and peers as relevant). The course covers best practice guidelines and is guided by a scientist-practitioner approach.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"8975626bdbf99850eb6b147a3a961977","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Written final examination","assessment_type":{"label":"Examination","value":"examination"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"50","description":"

There will be a 2-hour examination held on campus [i.e. NOT on Moodle] during the University examination period (time and location TBA). The examination will cover all course lecture and reading material. No student should organise travel during this period until the final examination schedule has been released and the date of the exam is known. The final exam will be worth 50% of the total course mark. Further details regarding the exact time and location of the exam will be released on myUNSW as they become available.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"0575626bdbf99850eb6b147a3a96196e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"4175626bdbf99850eb6b147a3a961971","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"8d75626bdbf99850eb6b147a3a961973","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"b875626bdbf99850eb6b147a3a961968","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"f475626bdbf99850eb6b147a3a96196b","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"3c75626bdbf99850eb6b147a3a961952","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Assessment tool presentation","assessment_type":{"label":"Presentation","value":"presentation"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"25","description":"

Students will present on a single assessment tool/measure for assessing a specific childhood emotional or behavioural problem, including but not limited to the Child Behavior Checklist (CBCL), Conners, Multidimensional Anxiety Scale for Children (MASC), Children’s Depression Inventory (CDI), Spence Children’s Anxiety Scale, Inventory of Callous-Unemotional Traits (ICU), and Eyberg Child Behavior Inventory (ECBI)/ Sutter-Eyberg Student Behavior Inventory (SESBI-R). Guidelines for the assessment will be provided in Week 2. Presentations must be no longer than 10 minutes in length. Students will be required to contribute to a measures database in Excel that details key features of the assessment tool (e.g., construct designed to be measured, age range, reporter, number of items, time to complete, psychometric properties, etc.).

Written feedback will be provided within 10 working days.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"0575626bdbf99850eb6b147a3a96196e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"8d75626bdbf99850eb6b147a3a961973","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"b875626bdbf99850eb6b147a3a961968","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"f475626bdbf99850eb6b147a3a96196b","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"a875626bdbf99850eb6b147a3a961949","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Podcast","assessment_type":{"label":"Presentation","value":"presentation"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"25","description":"

Students will pair up to create an educational and entertaining podcast on a specific child or adult psychological disorder, in the format of an interview, and targeted at a lay public audience. Students must first gain approval on their selected topic from the course coordinator. Students are encouraged to be as creative as possible and to be inspired by existing popular podcasts. Guidelines for the assignment will be provided in class in Week 3. Students will submit to the course coordinator a finalised podcast recording and written transcript that is no longer than 10 minutes, and is in in MP3 format.

Written feedback will be provided within 10 working days.

","erg":[],"campus":{"name":""}},"additional_information":"","study_level_tooltip":"Postgraduate: A level of study that leads to the award of a Graduate Certificate, Graduate Diploma, Masters Degree or Doctorate.","campus":"Sydney","study_level_single":{"label":"Postgraduate","value":"pgrd"},"code":"PSYC7210","attributes":[],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"PSYC7210 - Clinical Neuropsychology","description":"

This course introduces clinical psychologists to the principles of neuropsychology. The course commences with an overview of the neuroanatomy of the brain, followed by discussion of major areas of cognitive function that can be disrupted by focal brain lesions. Some common neurological disorders will then be described including characteristic presentations on cognitive testing. The course will finish with a focus on rehabilitation of brain injury and evidence based practice for interventions to address neuropsychological disorders.

This two hour exam will cover material covered in the first half (weeks 1-5) of the course.  The exam will be held in Week 7.  Feedback will be provided online via Moodle in Week 9.  

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"1adc4ea3dbf59850eb6b147a3a9619b0","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"56dc4ea3dbf59850eb6b147a3a9619b3","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"96dc4ea3dbf59850eb6b147a3a961988","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"a2dc4ea3dbf59850eb6b147a3a9619b6","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"eedc4ea3dbf59850eb6b147a3a9619b8","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"4edc4ea3dbf59850eb6b147a3a961975","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Exam 2","assessment_type":{"label":"Examination","value":"examination"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"35","description":"

This two hour exam will cover material covered in the second half (weeks 6-10) of the course.  The exam will be held during the exam period.  Feedback will be provided online via Moodle within 10 days from the day of the exam. 

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"1adc4ea3dbf59850eb6b147a3a9619b0","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"56dc4ea3dbf59850eb6b147a3a9619b3","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"a2dc4ea3dbf59850eb6b147a3a9619b6","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"eedc4ea3dbf59850eb6b147a3a9619b8","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"86dc4ea3dbf59850eb6b147a3a96197a","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Group presentation","assessment_type":{"label":"Presentation","value":"presentation"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"30","description":"

In the final week you will be asked to conduct a debate (35 minutes) in which you and your team members argue the merits of particular approaches to neuropsychological rehabilitation. The oral presentation and handouts will be assessed.  Feedback will be provided online via Moodle within 10 days of the presentation.

This course takes a scientist-practitioner approach, linking conceptual models of the aetiology and maintenance of clinical disorders with empirically-supported clinical interventions. A strong emphasis will be placed on links between experimental psychology and clinical practice.

","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"6975626bdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619bd","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Written final examination","assessment_type":{"label":"Examination","value":"examination"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"50","description":"

The examination will include two parts: short answer questions and an intervention plan for one case. Both parts will cover all course lecture and reading material.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"2175626bdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619b7","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"6d75626bdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619b9","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"e175626bdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619b4","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"1d75626bdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619aa","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Intervention Plan","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"50","description":"

This assessment will require students to develop an intervention plan for one case, detailing the approach they would take for the initial assessment, including selection of assessment devices, the treatment approach they would be considering, and how they would evaluate progress and outcome. 

\n

Written feedback will be provided within 10 working days.

contentlets.description: This course takes a scientist-practitioner approach, linking conceptual models of the aetiology and maintenance of clinical disorders with empirically-supported clinical interventions. A strong emphasis will be placed on links between experimental psychology and clinical practice.
contentlets.title: Adult and Child Clinical Psychology 1

","erg":[],"campus":{"name":""}},"additional_information":"","study_level_tooltip":"Postgraduate: A level of study that leads to the award of a Graduate Certificate, Graduate Diploma, Masters Degree or Doctorate.","campus":"Sydney","study_level_single":{"label":"Postgraduate","value":"pgrd"},"code":"PSYC7220","attributes":[],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"PSYC7220 - Psychology of Health and Illness","description":"

Applications of psychological principles, derived from human and animal research, to human health and rehabilitation including health promotion, risk factor reduction, psychological assessment, management and remediation of medical and neurological disorders, with a special focus on chronic illnesses.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"ead1d9ffdbb91c50eb6b147a3a961905","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Behavioural change assignment","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"50","description":"

This assessment comprises a 2500 word written report (approximately 10 A4 pages) related to health behaviours. The assignment utilises skills in literature search and synthesis, and application of knowledge in a behavioural-change framework. The background and rationale for the assignment is due in Week 5 and is worth 25% of your final grade; the data tracking and summary/discussion is due after Week 10 and is worth 25% of your final grade.

This assessment is a take home essay assessing all course content.  The due date will be during the exam period.  Marks and feedback will be returned to students within 10 days of the due date.

contentlets.description: Applications of psychological principles, derived from human and animal research, to human health and rehabilitation including health promotion, risk factor reduction, psychological assessment, management and remediation of medical and neurological disorders, with a special focus on chronic illnesses.
contentlets.title: Psychology of Health and Illness

","erg":[],"campus":{"name":""}},"additional_information":"","study_level_tooltip":"Postgraduate: A level of study that leads to the award of a Graduate Certificate, Graduate Diploma, Masters Degree or Doctorate.","campus":"Sydney","study_level_single":{"label":"Postgraduate","value":"pgrd"},"code":"PSYC7221","attributes":[],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"PSYC7221 - Experimental and Clinical Psychology","description":"

A continuation of the problem-oriented approach begun in PSYC7212, this course examines the theoretical basis of models of psychopathology, assessment and intervention, and related professional issues. This course covers a range of topics which include psychopharmacology and evidence-based practice.

","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"db4666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619c6","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Essay","assessment_type":{"label":"Assignment","value":"assignment"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"30","description":"

Students will be provided with an essay question in the Psychopharmacology workshop.  

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"034666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a96199c","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"1b4666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619ba","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"574666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619bd","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"5f4666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a96199e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"934666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619c0","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"df4666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619c2","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"0b4666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a961989","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Thought Papers","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"15","description":"

Students will write brief thought papers (250 words) on three of the six Evidence-Based-Practice workshops offered during the teaching period. Students may choose to provide more than three thought papers, in which case the three papers with the highest marks will be used to calculate their final mark.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"034666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a96199c","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"1b4666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619ba","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"574666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619bd","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"934666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619c0","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"df4666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619c2","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"3a4666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a961978","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Essay 2","assessment_type":{"label":"Assignment","value":"assignment"},"assessment_id":"4","weighting":"20","description":"

Students will be provided with an essay question on Peter Lovibond’s Evidence-based practice workshops. 

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"034666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a96199c","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"1b4666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619ba","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"574666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619bd","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"5f4666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a96199e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"934666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619c0","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"df4666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619c2","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"434666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a96198e","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Research thesis proposal","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"5","weighting":"","description":"

Masters students will prepare a research proposal for their research thesis.  They will organise a panel meeting with their supervisor and another clinical academic staff member. This assessment will not be marked, but will be assessed as pass/fail.  If a student is in the combined MA/Phd program, they will undergo a parallel process with their PhD proposal. The masters thesis proposal should not exceed 5,000 words and should be emailed to the student’s research supervisor and the panel member at least 3 days prior to the panel meeting.  The proposal is due Friday Week 11.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"1b4666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619ba","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"4b4666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a961992","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Group presentations and handouts on evidence-based treatments","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"35","description":"

Students will present an empirically-supported treatment (EST) for a specific disorder in threes/pairs for approximately 90 minutes. When preparing for the presentation, students are encouraged to discuss their ideas and the selection of reading materials with the lecturer beforehand. Students should ensure that they seek this feedback with adequate time to incorporate it into their presentation.

When presenting the techniques, presenters should be prepared to describe the technical aspects of the approach in some detail, including a demonstration of the approach either as role-plays or on videotape. Also included may be provision of materials needed for the approach such as self-monitoring forms, treatment manuals or other therapeutic aids. The content, style and originality of the presentation will contribute to the grade.

One week prior to the presentation, presenters are expected to distribute copies of the reading materials they have selected. Each presentation should include a brief review of the empirical evidence supporting the use of the approach, particularly when compared to other approaches. Most of the time, however, should be devoted to describing and demonstrating the approach in some detail (e.g., by role-playing, illustrating a case, using videotapes, audiotapes, etc.).

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"034666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a96199c","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"1b4666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619ba","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"574666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619bd","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"934666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619c0","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"df4666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a9619c2","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"fe4666ebdbf99850eb6b147a3a961973","links":[]}]}],"inactive_course_alert":null,"timetableURL":"http://timetable.unsw.edu.au/2021/PSYC7221.html","subject_sample_text_staticcontent":"To access course outline, please visit:","links":[]}

","erg":[],"campus":{"name":""}},"additional_information":"","study_level_tooltip":"Postgraduate: A level of study that leads to the award of a Graduate Certificate, Graduate Diploma, Masters Degree or Doctorate.","campus":"Sydney","study_level_single":{"label":"Postgraduate","value":"pgrd"},"code":"PSYC7222","attributes":[],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"PSYC7222 - Advanced Topics in Clinical Psychology","description":"

This course is comprised of five workshops in which you will be encouraged to take a strong scientist-practitioner approach, linking conceptual models of the aetiology and maintenance of clinical disorders with empirically-supported clinical interventions. A strong emphasis will be placed on the links between experimental psychology and clinical practice. In this course you will learn about the clinical skills and procedures that you will need to diagnose, assess and deliver cognitive-behavioural treatments for each of the complex psychological conditions covered.

","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"d6e6117fdbf91c50eb6b147a3a9619c4","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Thought papers","assessment_type":{"label":"Assignment","value":"assignment"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"20","description":"

Students will write brief thought papers (250 words) on each of the workshops in the course. The presenters will provide a question at the end of each of the workshops. 

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"42e6117fdbf91c50eb6b147a3a9619bb","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"8ee6117fdbf91c50eb6b147a3a9619bd","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"cae6117fdbf91c50eb6b147a3a9619c0","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"2de6117fdbf91c50eb6b147a3a961987","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Essay","assessment_type":{"label":"Essay","value":"essay"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"30","description":"

Students will be provided with an essay question in the Cross-Cultural Considerations in Clinical Practice workshop. 

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"42e6117fdbf91c50eb6b147a3a9619bb","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"8ee6117fdbf91c50eb6b147a3a9619bd","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"cae6117fdbf91c50eb6b147a3a9619c0","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"65e6117fdbf91c50eb6b147a3a96198c","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Intervention Plan","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"50","description":"

Students will be given case descriptions and must choose one about which to prepare a 3000-word intervention plan.

\n

Students will be expected to describe how they would go about conducting an assessment, developing a case formulation and carrying out a treatment for the client in the vignette. Students should draw on the relevant theoretical and clinical literature to support the conceptual and empirical rationale for the approach that they outline.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"42e6117fdbf91c50eb6b147a3a9619bb","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"8ee6117fdbf91c50eb6b147a3a9619bd","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"cae6117fdbf91c50eb6b147a3a9619c0","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"e1e6117fdbf91c50eb6b147a3a961983","links":[]}]}],"inactive_course_alert":null,"timetableURL":"http://timetable.unsw.edu.au/2021/PSYC7222.html","subject_sample_text_staticcontent":"To access course outline, please visit:","links":[]}

In this course you will learn about the clinical skills and procedures that you will need to diagnose, assess and deliver cognitive-behavioural treatments for each of the complex psychological conditions covered.

Please visit WIL website for more information."}],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"PSYC7223 - Professional and Ethical Practice (Clinical) 1","description":"

PEP1 (Clinical) provides an orientation to the profession of clinical psychology, an introduction to the practical component of the clinical program and a graded entry into client work. The course begins to develop trainee technical and professional competencies through clinical workshops, weekly professional meetings, clinic activities observation period in the UNSW Psychology Clinic, engagement in client intake and supervisor feedback regarding foundational clinical skills via a role-play assessment.

Preparation of video recording of extended role play via Psychology Clinic recording system (with a fellow-trainee, who role-plays a client) that includes an assessment interview, risk assessment, feedback of case formulation and brief discussion of treatment plan. Any client paperwork completed in the session (incl. formulation diagram) should be handed in as part of the assessment.  Submit details of recording session (on Cotag) via email to Chien Gooi along with digital copy of self-reflection write-up and session paperwork.  Verbal feedback from Clinic Supervisors will be provided to Trainees in individual sessions.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"f038af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a3","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"f438af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a6","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"fc38af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a3","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"fc38af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a4","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"fc38af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a5","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"fc38af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a6","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"3838af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619aa","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Risk aware modules","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"4","weighting":"","description":"

Completion of all modules on the online self-directed Risk Aware learning program, which increases trainee ability to identify and manage risk in the clinical placement context.  Immediate feedback is provided at the completion of each online Module.  Please upload to Moodle completion certificates for all modules.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"f038af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a3","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"f438af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a4","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"f438af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a5","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"f438af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a6","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"fc38af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a3","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"fc38af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a4","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"fc38af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a5","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"fc38af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a6","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"fc38af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a7","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"6538ef7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a96190a","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Clinic activities observation period","assessment_type":{"label":"Performance","value":"performance"},"assessment_id":"5","weighting":"","description":"

At the completion of PEP1 clinic activities observation period, all trainees must submit to the Clinic Director: Completed Observation Checklist, Therapy Observation Log, Supervision Observation Log and Intake Observation Log.  Feedback from the Clinic Director and/or Supervisors will be provided to Trainees at the placement review meetings.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"f038af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a3","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"f438af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a4","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"f438af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a5","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"f438af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a6","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"fc38af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a3","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"fc38af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a4","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"fc38af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a5","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"fc38af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a6","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"fc38af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a7","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"8a38ef7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a96194e","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Professional development journal","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"","description":"

A 500-word professional development journal for each workshop summarising workshop content, reflections from workshop material and follow-up learning activities associated with workshop material. Due 7 days after each workshop.  Marks and written/verbal feedback from workshop presenters/clinical staff will be provided to Trainees within 10 working days of submission. 

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"f038af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a3","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"f438af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a4","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"f438af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a5","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"f438af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a6","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"f438af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a7","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"fc38af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a3","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"fc38af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a4","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"fc38af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a5","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"fc38af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a6","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"fc38af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a7","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"cd38af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619bf","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Workshop and meeting attendance","assessment_type":{"label":"Attendance","value":"attendance"},"assessment_id":"6","weighting":"100","description":"

Students must attend 80% of workshops and meetings to ensure they are consistently working towards achieving the professional graduate competencies for specialised areas of practice required by the APAC Accreditation Standards. These Accreditation Standards are incorporated in Program and Course Learning Outcomes. Any absence must be accompanied by a medical certificate or other reason for absence. Additional self-study material may be assigned by the Course Convenor to ensure that the trainee has covered any material missed as a result of being absent from workshops or meetings.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"f038af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a3","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"f438af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a4","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"f438af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a5","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"f438af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a6","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"f438af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a7","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"fc38af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a3","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"fc38af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a4","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"fc38af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a5","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"fc38af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a6","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"fc38af7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a9619a7","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"de38ef7bdbe29010eb6b147a3a961965","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Self-reflection","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"","description":"

Self-reflection write-up on recorded extended role play (500 words describing specific aspects of role play done well and areas that require improvement; additional 200 words addressing provisional and differential diagnoses considered based on the assessment).  Submit details of recording session (on Cotag) via email to Chien Gooi along with digital copy of self-reflection write-up and session paperwork.  Verbal feedback will be provided by Clinic Supervisors to Trainees during individual sessions.

contentlets.description: PEP1 (Clinical) provides an orientation to the profession of clinical psychology, an introduction to the practical component of the clinical program and a graded entry into client work. The course begins to develop trainee technical and professional competencies through clinical workshops, weekly professional meetings, clinic activities observation period in the UNSW Psychology Clinic, engagement in client intake and supervisor feedback regarding foundational clinical skills via a role-play assessment.
contentlets.title: Professional and Ethical Practice (Clinical) 1

PEP2 (Clinical) follows from PEP1, and provides ongoing training as part of the practical component of the clinical program. In PEP2 trainees are required to attend clinical workshops, complete a supervised placement in the UNSW Psychology Clinic, and attend weekly PEP and Neuro/Psychometric meetings.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"a87be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961928","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Audio-visual session recordings","assessment_type":{"label":"Performance","value":"performance"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"","description":"

Client session recordings (around 20 minutes in length) to be presented with self-reflections to Clinic Supervisors. These recordings must include different session types across different age groups (e.g., assessment/therapy, child/adult). Trainees must submit at least one recording per month while on placement.  Clinic supervisors will provide verbal feedback during supervision and placement review meetings.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"107be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961914","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"1c7be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961904","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"247be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96191f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"5c7be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961916","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"607be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961922","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"907ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619ff","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"987be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961919","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"ac7be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961924","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"dc7be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961901","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"e47be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96191c","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"047ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619cf","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Workshop and meeting attendance","assessment_type":{"label":"Attendance","value":"attendance"},"assessment_id":"5","weighting":"100","description":"

Students must attend 80% of workshops and meetings to ensure they are consistently working towards achieving the professional graduate competencies for specialised areas of practice required by the APAC Accreditation Standards. These Accreditation Standards are incorporated in Program and Course Learning Outcomes. Any absence must be accompanied by a medical certificate or other reason for absence. Additional self-study material may be assigned by the Course Convenor to ensure that the trainee has covered any material missed as a result of being absent from workshops or meetings.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"107be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961914","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"1c7be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961904","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"247be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96191f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"5c7be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961916","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"607be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961922","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"907ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619ff","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"987be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961919","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"ac7be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961924","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"dc7be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961901","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"e47be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96191c","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"047ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619e9","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Professional and ethical practice in UNSW Psychology clinic placement","assessment_type":{"label":"Performance","value":"performance"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"","description":"

Professional and ethical practice on placement in the UNSW Psychology Clinic, including: timely completion of all client work, attendance at scheduled supervision and intake sessions, attendance at professional meetings and completion of all intake and administrative duties to a satisfactory level.  Feedback will be provided by the Clinic Director and Supervisors during supervision and placement meetings conducted at regular intervals throughout the duration of the clinical placement. 

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"107be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961914","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"1c7be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961904","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"247be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96191f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"5c7be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961916","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"607be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961922","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"907ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619ff","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"987be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961919","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"ac7be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961924","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"dc7be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961901","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"e47be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96191c","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"0c7ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619d3","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Therapy case presentation","assessment_type":{"label":"Presentation","value":"presentation"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"","description":"

One oral adult or child therapy case presentation in weekly Professional Practice meetings.  Due at the completion of the Psychology clinic placement.  Feedback will be provided verbally by the clinic supervisor during individual sessions.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"107be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961914","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"1c7be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961904","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"247be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96191f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"607be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961922","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"907ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619ff","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"987be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961919","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"ac7be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961924","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"dc7be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961901","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"e47be5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96191c","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"3f6ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619ca","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Psychology clinic placement documentation","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"4","weighting":"","description":"

Trainees are required to submit, where relevant, copies of their: Supervision Contract, Mid and End Placement Review Reports (for both adult and child work) and copies of their signed placement logbooks to the Clinic Director as soon as these documents have been completed and signed off by the relevant supervisors. Trainees are also required to submit a copy of the Mid-Placement Trainee Self-Evaluation Form to their supervisors at least one week prior to the Mid Placement Review meeting.

Please visit WIL website for more information."}],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"PSYC7225 - Professional and Ethical Practice (Clinical) 3","description":"

PEP3 (Clinical) follows from PEP2, and provides ongoing training as part of the practical component of the clinical program. The aim of the course is to further develop the clinical competencies of trainees and increase clinical experience across a wide range of client presentations. In PEP3 trainees are required to complete a placement in the UNSW Psychology Clinic, complete an external placement, and attend weekly professional meetings.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"469f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96191e","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Audio-visual session recordings","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"","description":"

Minimum of 5 audio-visual client session recordings to be presented with self-reflections to Clinic Supervisors. These recordings must include at least 1 neuropsychology session, 1 child session, 3 adult therapy sessions. Trainees must submit at least one recording per month while on placement.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"0e9f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961917","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"4a9f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96191a","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"6d9f297fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619cc","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Therapy case presentation","assessment_type":{"label":"Presentation","value":"presentation"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"10","description":"

One oral therapy case presentation in weekly Professional Practice meetings – can be cases from Psychology Clinic or external placements.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"0e9f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961917","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"4a9f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96191a","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"9d9f297fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619aa","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Case report","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"4","weighting":"25","description":"

One case report (of maximum 2500 words) must be submitted (see Professional Practice Guidelines booklet for guidance on preparing case reports). 

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"0e9f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961917","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"4a9f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96191a","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"a59f297fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619d1","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Professional and ethical practice in Psychology Clinic","assessment_type":{"label":"Performance","value":"performance"},"assessment_id":"5","weighting":"","description":"

Professional and ethical practice in the UNSW Psychology Clinic, including timely completion of all client work, attendance at scheduled supervision and intake sessions, attendance at professional meetings and completion of intake and administrative duties, which include assisting PEP1 trainees to learn clinic procedures and allowing clinic activity observation by PEP1 trainees.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"0e9f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961917","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"4a9f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96191a","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"ad9f297fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619d5","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Copy of External End Placement Review Report and Professional Log","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"12","weighting":"","description":"

At the completion of the External placement, all trainees must submit to the Placement Coordinator copies of:

  • a. VMAT-CYPRS End of Placement Review Report
  • b. Completed and signed Professional Log
","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"0e9f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961917","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"4a9f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96191a","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"bd9f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961901","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Neuro/psychometric case presentation","assessment_type":{"label":"Presentation","value":"presentation"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"10","description":"

One oral case presentation in weekly Neuro/Psychometric meetings .

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"0e9f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961917","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"4a9f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96191a","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"e59f297fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619af","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Psychology clinic placement","assessment_type":{"label":"Performance","value":"performance"},"assessment_id":"6","weighting":"55","description":"

Clinical placement at the UNSW Psychology Clinic Placement – overall mark (22% adult therapy; 22% child therapy & assessment; 11% adult neuro).

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"0e9f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961917","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"4a9f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96191a","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"e59f297fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619da","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Copies of Mid Placement Trainee Self-Evaluation and Review Reports (adult & child)","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"7","weighting":"","description":"

Midway through Psychology Clinic Placement, all trainees must submit their completed Mid-Placement Trainee Self-Evaluation Form to their supervisors at least one week prior to the mid placement review meeting. At the conclusion of the mid placement review, trainees are required to submit a copy of their CYPRS Mid Placement Review Reports (both adult and child) to the Clinic Director.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"0e9f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961917","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"4a9f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96191a","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"ed9f297fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619de","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Copies of End Placement Review Reports (adult & child) and Professional Log","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"8","weighting":"","description":"

At the completion of the Psychology Clinic placement, all trainees must submit to the Clinic Director copies of:

  • VMAT-CYPRS End of Placement Review Report (adult)
  • VMAT-CYPRS End of Placement Review Report (child)
  • Completed and signed Professional Log
","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"0e9f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961917","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"4a9f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96191a","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"f59f297fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619e3","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Copy of External Supervision Contract","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"10","weighting":"","description":"

At the beginning of external placement, all trainees must submit a copy of their Supervision Contract to the Placement Coordinator.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"0e9f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961917","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"4a9f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96191a","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"f59f297fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619ec","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Completion of one External Placement","assessment_type":{"label":"Performance","value":"performance"},"assessment_id":"9","weighting":"","description":"

Trainees must adequately complete at least 250 hours of placement at one external placement site, which includes undertaking variety of active client work, attending clinical supervision and completing related administrative tasks and client preparation.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"0e9f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961917","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"4a9f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96191a","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"fd9f297fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619e7","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Copies of External Mid Placement Trainee Self-Evaluation & Review Report","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"11","weighting":"","description":"

Midway through External Placement, all trainees must submit their completed Mid-Placement Trainee Self-Evaluation Form to their supervisor at least one week prior to the mid placement review meeting. At the conclusion of the mid placement review, trainees are required to submit a copy of their CYPRS Mid Placement Review Report to the Placement Coordinator.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"0e9f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961917","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"4a9f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96191a","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"fd9f297fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619f0","links":[]}]}],"inactive_course_alert":null,"timetableURL":"http://timetable.unsw.edu.au/2021/PSYC7225.html","subject_sample_text_staticcontent":"To access course outline, please visit:","links":[]}
contentlets.description: PEP3 (Clinical) follows from PEP2, and provides ongoing training as part of the practical component of the clinical program. The aim of the course is to further develop the clinical competencies of trainees and increase clinical experience across a wide range of client presentations. In PEP3 trainees are required to complete a placement in the UNSW Psychology Clinic, complete an external placement, and attend weekly professional meetings.
contentlets.title: Professional and Ethical Practice (Clinical) 3

PEP4 (Clinical) follows from PEP3, and provides ongoing training as part of the practical component of the clinical program. The aim of the course is to further develop clinical competencies of trainees and increase clinical experience across a range of client presentations. In PEP4 trainees are required to attend clinical workshops and complete an external placement.

","erg":[],"campus":{"name":""}},"additional_information":"","study_level_tooltip":"Postgraduate: A level of study that leads to the award of a Graduate Certificate, Graduate Diploma, Masters Degree or Doctorate.","campus":"Sydney","study_level_single":{"label":"Postgraduate","value":"pgrd"},"code":"PSYC7227","attributes":[],"credit_points_header":"12 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"PSYC7227 - Research Thesis (Clinical) 1","description":"

This course involves undertaking a research project under the supervision of a member of academic staff in the School of Psychology. Research projects may be carried out on any topic that is relevant to clinical or abnormal psychology. Students are required to prepare a thesis in the form of a journal article. Refer to the Guide to Research Projects available on the School website http://www.psy.unsw.edu.au/postgraduate-coursework/master-psychology-clinical.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"c1909880dbccb850fe4b322af496193e","name":"Independent research - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Research Thesis","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"100","description":"

In order to pass Research Thesis 1 and progress to Research Thesis 2, supervisors will be required to indicate that students have made adequate progress on their thesis project.

If adequate progress is made on the thesis project, students will receive a grade of EC (Enrolment Continuing) for Research Thesis 1.

The completed thesis is marked by two members of the School's academic staff. The supervisor is not involved in marking the thesis.

Once the mark for Research Thesis 2 is confirmed in the subsequent semester, this mark will replace the EC grade allocated Research Thesis 1.

contentlets.description: This course involves undertaking a research project under the supervision of a member of academic staff in the School of Psychology. Research projects may be carried out on any topic that is relevant to clinical or abnormal psychology. Students are required to prepare a thesis in the form of a journal article. Refer to the Guide to Research Projects available on the School website http://www.psy.unsw.edu.au/postgraduate-coursework/master-psychology-clinical.

contentlets.description: This course involves undertaking a research project under the supervision of a member of academic staff in the School of Psychology. Research projects may be carried out on any topic that is relevant to clinical or abnormal psychology. Students are required to prepare a thesis in the form of a journal article.  Refer to the Guide to Research Projects available on the School website http://www.psy.unsw.edu.au/postgraduate-coursework/master-psychology-clinical.

This course involves undertaking a research project under the supervision of a member of academic staff in the School of Psychology. Research projects may be carried out on any topic that is relevant to clinical or abnormal psychology. Students are required to prepare a thesis in the form of a journal article. Refer to the Guide to Research Projects available on the School website http://www.psy.unsw.edu.au/postgraduate-coursework/master-psychology-clinical.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"7ffaae77dbb2e850be4672f5f39619b8","name":"Independent research - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Research methods workshops","assessment_type":{"label":"Attendance","value":"attendance"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"","description":"

Attendance at five Research Methods workshops over the course of T1 is required to ensure students are working towards achieving the professional graduate competencies for specialised areas of practice required by the APAC Accreditation Standards. These Accreditation Standards are incorporated in Program and Course Learning Outcomes.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"3ffaae77dbb2e850be4672f5f39619ba","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"f3faee77dbb2e850be4672f5f39619c1","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"f3faee77dbb2e850be4672f5f39619c2","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"f3faee77dbb2e850be4672f5f39619c3","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"fbfaee77dbb2e850be4672f5f39619c0","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"fbfaee77dbb2e850be4672f5f39619c1","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"fbfaee77dbb2e850be4672f5f39619c2","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"fbfaee77dbb2e850be4672f5f39619c3","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"8c0bee77dbb2e850be4672f5f39619c5","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Research Thesis","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"100","description":"

Two paper copies of your thesis should be submitted to the School Office, using the standard folders supplied by the School. An e-copy of your complete thesis (as a PDF file) is to be submitted to the Administrative Officer (Postgraduate Support) on the same day. An e-copy of both your thesis (as a PDF file) and the data collected (in either SPSS or Excel) should be emailed to your supervisor. You will also be required to upload a copy of your thesis (from Abstract to Discussion) to the Turnitin link set up on Moodle.

After marking, one copy of your thesis will be retained by your supervisor, and the second copy will be available for you to collect from the School Office. You should make as many additional copies as you may need for your own purposes. For example, any organisation or individual who was particularly helpful to you in your research may appreciate receiving a copy of the thesis.

This course involves undertaking a research project under the supervision of a member of academic staff in the School of Psychology. Research projects may be carried out on any topic that is relevant to clinical or abnormal psychology. Students are required to prepare a thesis in the form of a journal article. Refer to the Guide to Research Projects available on the School website http://www.psy.unsw.edu.au/postgraduate-coursework/master-psychology-clinical.

","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"7658741edb043490fe4b322af49619d5","name":"Independent research - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Research Thesis","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"100","description":"

Students must submit and pass a 24 UOC research thesis which constitutes 100% of the mark for this course.

Where adequate progress is made on the thesis, as determined by the supervisor and Program Director, a grade of EC (Enrolment Continuing) will be applied as a holding grade for the course in the first, second, and third (where applicable*) instance they are enrolled.

The completed thesis is marked by two members of the School's academic staff. The supervisor is not involved in marking the thesis.

Once the mark for thesis is finalised, and added to the course for the final instance/s* the student is enrolled, this mark will be backfilled (replacing the EC grade) to all previous instances of the course.

* It is envisaged that a student will enrol in this course as follows:

  • Standard full-time load, twice in T1 and twice in T3
    • EC will be applied as a holding grade twice in T1; when the mark is finalised and uploaded to both instances of enrolment in T3, the mark will then be backfilled to both instances in T1.
  • Standard part-time load, once in T1, twice in T2, and once in T3
    • EC will be applied as a holding grade once in T1 and twice in T2; when the mark is finalised and uploaded in T3, the mark will then be backfilled to all instances in T1 and T2.

","erg":[],"campus":{"name":""}},"additional_information":"","study_level_tooltip":"Postgraduate: A level of study that leads to the award of a Graduate Certificate, Graduate Diploma, Masters Degree or Doctorate.","campus":"Sydney","study_level_single":{"label":"Postgraduate","value":"pgrd"},"code":"PSYC7232","attributes":[],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"PSYC7232 - Research Thesis (Clinical) 3","description":"

This course involves undertaking a research project under the supervision of a member of academic staff in the School of Psychology. Research projects may be carried out on any topic that is relevant to clinical or abnormal psychology. Students are required to prepare a thesis in the form of a journal article. Refer to the Guide to Research Projects available on the School website http://www.psy.unsw.edu.au/postgraduate-coursework/master-psychology-clinical.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"e899f09edb043490fe4b322af4961940","name":"Independent research - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Research Thesis","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"100","description":"

Two paper copies of your thesis should be submitted to the School Office, using the standard folders supplied by the School. An e-copy of your complete thesis (as a PDF file) is to be submitted to the Administrative Officer (Postgraduate Support) on the same day. An e-copy of both your thesis (as a PDF file) and the data collected (in either SPSS or Excel) should be emailed to your supervisor. You will also be required to upload a copy of your thesis (from Abstract to Discussion) to the Turnitin link set up on Moodle.

\n

After marking, one copy of your thesis will be retained by your supervisor, and the second copy will be available for you to collect from the School Office. You should make as many additional copies as you may need for your own purposes. For example, any organisation or individual who was particularly helpful to you in your research may appreciate receiving a copy of the thesis.

Research projects may be carried out on any topic that is relevant to clinical or abnormal psychology. Students are required to prepare a thesis in the form of a journal article. Please visit WIL website for more information."}],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"PSYC7233 - Professional and Ethical Practice (Clinical) 3","description":"

PEP3 (Clinical) follows from PEP2, and provides ongoing training as part of the practical component of the clinical program. The aim of the course is to further develop the clinical competencies of trainees and increase clinical experience across a wide range of client presentations. In PEP3 trainees are required to continue with the supervised placement in the UNSW Psychology Clinic and attend weekly professional meetings.

","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"29f8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619d3","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Psychology Clinic Placement documentation","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"6","weighting":"5","description":"

Trainees are required to submit, where relevant, copies of their Supervision Contract, Mid and End Placement Review Reports (for both adult and child work) and copies of their signed placement logbooks to the Clinic Director as soon as these documents have been completed and signed off by the relevant supervisors. Trainees are also required to submit a copy of the Mid-Placement Trainee Self-Evaluation Form to their supervisors at least one week prior to the Mid Placement Review meeting.

One oral case presentation in weekly Neuro/Psychometric meetings to be completed by the end of the Psychology Clinic placement.  Feedback will be provided verbally by the clinic supervisor during individual sessions .

Students must attend 80% of workshops and meetings to ensure they are consistently working towards achieving the professional graduate competencies for specialised areas of practice required by the APAC Accreditation Standards. These Accreditation Standards are incorporated in Program and Course Learning Outcomes. Any absence must be accompanied by a medical certificate or other reason for absence. Additional self-study material may be assigned by the Course Convenor to ensure that the trainee has covered any material missed as a result of being absent from workshops or meetings.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"15f8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961978","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"19f8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961983","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"29f8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619c0","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"51f8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96197b","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"51f8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619b8","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"65f8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619c3","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"9df8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96197d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"adf8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619ba","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"d9f8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961980","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"e9f8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619bd","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"45f8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96196a","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"UNSW Forensic and Clinical Psychology Research Conference attendance","assessment_type":{"label":"Attendance","value":"attendance"},"assessment_id":"8","weighting":"5","description":"

Trainees are required to attend the Annual UNSW Forensic and Clinical Psychology Research Conference.

\n","learning_outcomes":[],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"4df8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96196e","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Audio-visual session recordings","assessment_type":{"label":"Performance","value":"performance"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"5","description":"

Client session recordings (around 20 minutes in length) to be presented with self-reflections to Clinic Supervisors. These recordings must include different session types across different age groups (e.g., assessment/therapy, child/adult). Trainees must submit at least one recording per month (due end of calendar month) while on placement. Clinic supervisors will provide verbal feedback during supervision and placement review meetings.  

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"15f8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961978","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"19f8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961983","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"29f8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619c0","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"51f8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96197b","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"51f8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619b8","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"65f8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619c3","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"9df8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96197d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"adf8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619ba","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"d9f8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961980","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"e9f8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619bd","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"70f8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961958","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Case report","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"4","weighting":"5","description":"

One case report (of maximum 2500 words) must be submitted (see Professional Practice Guidelines booklet for guidance on preparing case reports).  Written feedback will be provided by Clinic Supervisors by the completion of the placement.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"15f8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961978","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"19f8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961983","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"29f8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619c0","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"51f8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96197b","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"51f8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619b8","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"65f8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619c3","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"9df8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96197d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"adf8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619ba","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"d9f8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961980","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"e9f8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619bd","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"b8f8adfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96195c","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Professional and ethical practice in UNSW Psychology Clinic placement","assessment_type":{"label":"Performance","value":"performance"},"assessment_id":"5","weighting":"5","description":"

Professional and ethical practice on placement in the UNSW Psychology Clinic, including: timely completion of all client work, attendance at scheduled supervision and intake sessions, attendance at professional meetings and completion of all intake and administrative duties to a satisfactory level.  Feedback will be provided by the Clinic Director and Supervisors during supervision and placement meetings conducted at regular intervals throughout the duration of the clinical placement.

One oral adult or child therapy case presentation in weekly Professional Practice meetings to be completed by the end of the Psychology Clinic placement.  Feedback will be provided verbally by the clinic supervisor during individual sessions.
