Please visit WIL website for more information."}],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"PSYC7234 - Professional and Ethical Practice (Clinical) 4","description":"

PEP4 (Clinical) follows from PEP3, and provides ongoing training as part of the practical component of the clinical program. The aim of the course is to further develop the clinical competencies of trainees and increase clinical experience across a wide range of client presentations. In PEP4 trainees are required to continue with the supervised placement in the UNSW Psychology Clinic, attend a supervised external placement, and attend weekly professional meetings.

","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"baf8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96198a","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Professional and ethical practice in UNSW Psychology Clinic placement","assessment_type":{"label":"Performance","value":"performance"},"assessment_id":"5","weighting":"5","description":"

Professional and ethical practice on placement in the UNSW Psychology Clinic, including: timely completion of all client work, attendance at scheduled supervision and intake sessions, attendance at professional meetings and completion of all intake and administrative duties to a satisfactory level.  Feedback will be provided by the Clinic Director and Supervisors during supervision and placement meetings conducted at regular intervals throughout the duration of the clinical placement. 

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"22f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961976","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"36f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961981","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"6af8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96196d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"6ef8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961978","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"72f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961984","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"a6f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961970","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"aaf8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96197b","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"bef8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961986","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"e2f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961973","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"f6f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96197e","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"02f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961939","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Psychology Clinic Placement documentation","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"6","weighting":"5","description":"

Trainees are required to submit, where relevant, copies of their Supervision Contract, Mid and End Placement Review Reports (for both adult and child work) and copies of their signed placement logbooks to the Clinic Director as soon as these documents have been completed and signed off by the relevant supervisors. Trainees are also required to submit a copy of the Mid-Placement Trainee Self-Evaluation Form to their supervisors at least one week prior to the Mid Placement Review meeting.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"22f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961976","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"36f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961981","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"6af8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96196d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"6ef8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961978","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"72f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961984","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"a6f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961970","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"aaf8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96197b","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"bef8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961986","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"e2f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961973","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"f6f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96197e","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"4af8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96193d","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Meeting attendance","assessment_type":{"label":"Attendance","value":"attendance"},"assessment_id":"7","weighting":"60","description":"

Students must attend 80% of meetings to ensure they are consistently working towards achieving the professional graduate competencies for specialised areas of practice required by the APAC Accreditation Standards. These Accreditation Standards are incorporated in Program and Course Learning Outcomes. Any absence must be accompanied by a medical certificate or other reason for absence. Additional self-study material may be assigned by the Course Convenor to ensure that the trainee has covered any material missed as a result of being absent from workshops or meetings.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"22f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961976","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"36f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961981","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"6af8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96196d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"6ef8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961978","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"72f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961984","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"a6f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961970","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"aaf8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96197b","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"bef8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961986","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"e2f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961973","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"f6f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96197e","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"5af8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96194e","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Neuro/Psychometric case presentation","assessment_type":{"label":"Performance","value":"performance"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"5","description":"

One oral case presentation in weekly Neuro/Psychometric meetings to be completed by the end of the Psychology Clinic placement.  Feedback will be provided verbally by the clinic supervisor during individual sessions .

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"22f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961976","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"36f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961981","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"6af8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96196d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"6ef8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961978","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"72f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961984","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"a6f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961970","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"aaf8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96197b","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"bef8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961986","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"e2f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961973","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"f6f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96197e","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"8ef8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96190d","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Therapy Case Presentation","assessment_type":{"label":"Performance","value":"performance"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"5","description":"

One oral adult or child therapy case presentation in weekly Professional Practice meetings to be completed by the end of the Psychology Clinic placement.  Feedback will be provided verbally by the clinic supervisor during individual sessions.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"22f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961976","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"36f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961981","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"6af8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96196d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"72f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961984","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"a6f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961970","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"aaf8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96197b","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"bef8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961986","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"e2f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961973","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"f6f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96197e","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"8ef8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96191e","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Professional and ethical practice at external field placement","assessment_type":{"label":"Performance","value":"performance"},"assessment_id":"8","weighting":"5","description":"

Trainees must adequately complete at least 166 hours of supervised placement at an external placement site, which includes undertaking variety of active client work, attending clinical supervision and completing related administrative tasks and client preparation.  Field supervisors and/or Placement Coordinator will provide verbal feedback during supervision and placement review meetings.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"22f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961976","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"36f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961981","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"6af8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96196d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"6ef8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961978","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"72f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961984","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"a6f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961970","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"aaf8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96197b","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"bef8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961986","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"e2f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961973","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"f6f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96197e","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"92f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961953","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Audio-visual session recordings","assessment_type":{"label":"Performance","value":"performance"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"5","description":"

Client session recordings (around 20 minutes in length) to be presented with self-reflections to Clinic Supervisors. These recordings must include different session types across different age groups (e.g., assessment/therapy, child/adult). Trainees must submit at least one recording per month (due end of calendar month) while on placement. Clinic supervisors will provide verbal feedback during supervision and placement review meetings.  

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"22f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961976","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"36f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961981","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"6af8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96196d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"6ef8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961978","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"72f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961984","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"a6f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961970","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"aaf8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96197b","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"bef8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961986","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"e2f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961973","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"f6f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96197e","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"c6f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961923","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Case report","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"4","weighting":"5","description":"

One case report (of maximum 2500 words) must be submitted (see Professional Practice Guidelines booklet for guidance on preparing case reports).  Written feedback will be provided by Clinic Supervisors by the completion of the placement.

Please visit WIL website for more information."}],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"PSYC7235 - Professional and Ethical Practice (Clinical) 5","description":"

PEP5 (Clinical) follows from PEP4, and provides ongoing training as part of the practical component of the clinical program. The aim of the course is to further develop the clinical competencies of trainees and increase clinical experience across a wide range of client presentations. In PEP5 trainees are required to continue with supervised placement in an external placement, and attend clinical workshops. 

","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"7ff8213fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961932","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Field Placement documentation","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"5","description":"

Trainees are required to submit, where relevant, copies of their field placement Supervision Contract, Mid and End Placement Review Reports (for both adult and child work) and copies of their signed placement logbooks to the Placement Coordinator as soon as these documents have been completed and signed off by the relevant supervisors. Trainees are also required to submit a copy of the Mid-Placement Trainee Self-Evaluation Form to their supervisors at least one week prior to the Mid Placement Review meeting.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"27f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619f3","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"2bf8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619fe","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"63f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619f6","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"67f8213fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961901","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"73f8213fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96192f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"aff8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619f8","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"b3f8213fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961904","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"e7f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619f0","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"ebf8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619fb","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"fff8213fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961906","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"13f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619d6","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Workshop attendance","assessment_type":{"label":"Attendance","value":"attendance"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"90","description":"

Students must attend 80% of workshops to ensure they are consistently working towards achieving the professional graduate competencies for specialised areas of practice required by the APAC Accreditation Standards. These Accreditation Standards are incorporated in Program and Course Learning Outcomes. Any absence must be accompanied by a medical certificate or other reason for absence. Additional self-study material may be assigned by the Course Convenor to ensure that the trainee has covered any material missed as a result of being absent from workshops or meetings.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"27f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619f3","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"2bf8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619fe","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"63f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619f6","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"67f8213fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961901","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"73f8213fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96192f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"aff8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619f8","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"b3f8213fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961904","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"e7f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619f0","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"ebf8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619fb","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"fff8213fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961906","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"5bf8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619da","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Professional and ethical practice at external field placement","assessment_type":{"label":"Performance","value":"performance"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"5","description":"

Trainees must adequately complete at least 166 hours of supervised placement at an external placement site, which includes undertaking variety of active client work, attending clinical supervision and completing related administrative tasks and client preparation.  Field supervisors and/or Placement Coordinator will provide verbal feedback during supervision and placement review meetings.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"27f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619f3","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"2bf8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619fe","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"63f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619f6","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"67f8213fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961901","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"73f8213fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96192f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"aff8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619f8","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"b3f8213fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961904","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"e7f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619f0","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"ebf8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619fb","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"fff8213fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961906","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"d7f8edfbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619d1","links":[]}]}],"inactive_course_alert":null,"timetableURL":"http://timetable.unsw.edu.au/2021/PSYC7235.html","subject_sample_text_staticcontent":"To access course outline, please visit:","links":[]}

Please visit WIL website for more information."}],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"PSYC7236 - Professional and Ethical Practice (Clinical) 6","description":"

PEP6 (Clinical) follows from PEP5, and provides ongoing training as part of the practical component of the clinical program. The aim of the course is to further develop the clinical competencies of trainees and increase clinical experience across a wide range of client presentations. In PEP6 trainees are required to continue with supervised placement in an external placement, attend clinical workshops and present their research at the UNSW Forensic and Clinical Psychology Research Conference.

","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"7909613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96197f","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Workshop attendance","assessment_type":{"label":"Attendance","value":"attendance"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"60","description":"

Students must attend 80% of workshops to ensure they are consistently working towards achieving the professional graduate competencies for specialised areas of practice required by the APAC Accreditation Standards. These Accreditation Standards are incorporated in Program and Course Learning Outcomes. Any absence must be accompanied by a medical certificate or other reason for absence. Additional self-study material may be assigned by the Course Convenor to ensure that the trainee has covered any material missed as a result of being absent from workshops or meetings.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"2d09613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96196d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"3109613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961979","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"6109613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961956","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"6509613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961965","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"6909613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961970","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"7d09613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96197b","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"a109613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961968","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"b509613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961973","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"ed09613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96196a","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"f109613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961976","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"1909613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961943","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Professional and ethical practice at external field placement","assessment_type":{"label":"Performance","value":"performance"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"5","description":"

Trainees must adequately complete at least 166 hours of supervised placement at an external placement site, which includes undertaking variety of active client work, attending clinical supervision and completing related administrative tasks and client preparation.  Field supervisors and/or Placement Coordinator will provide verbal feedback during supervision and placement review meetings.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"2d09613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96196d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"3109613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961979","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"6109613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961956","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"6509613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961965","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"6909613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961970","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"7d09613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96197b","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"a109613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961968","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"b509613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961973","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"ed09613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96196a","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"f109613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961976","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"4109613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961915","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Case Reports","assessment_type":{"label":"Assignment","value":"assignment"},"assessment_id":"4","weighting":"5","description":"

Two case reports (of maximum 2500 words) must be submitted (see Professional Practice Guidelines booklet for guidance on preparing case reports).  Written feedback will be provided by Clinic Supervisors by the completion of the placement.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"2d09613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96196d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"3109613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961979","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"6109613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961956","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"6509613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961965","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"6909613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961970","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"7d09613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96197b","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"a109613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961968","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"b509613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961973","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"ed09613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96196a","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"f109613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961976","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"5109613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961948","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"UNSW Forensic and Clinical Psychology Research Conference oral presentation","assessment_type":{"label":"Presentation","value":"presentation"},"assessment_id":"5","weighting":"25","description":"

Trainees are required to attend and present their research at the Annual UNSW Forensic and Clinical Psychology Research Conference.  Verbal feedback will be provided by Course Convenor and conference attendees following the presentation. 

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"2d09613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96196d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"3109613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961979","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"6109613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961956","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"6509613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961965","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"6909613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961970","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"7d09613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96197b","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"a109613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961968","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"b509613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961973","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"ed09613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96196a","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"f109613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961976","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"9909613fdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96194c","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Field Placement documentation","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"5","description":"

Trainees are required to submit, where relevant, copies of their field placement Supervision Contract, Mid and End Placement Review Reports (for both adult and child work) and copies of their signed placement logbooks to the Placement Coordinator as soon as these documents have been completed and signed off by the relevant supervisors. Trainees are also required to submit a copy of the Mid-Placement Trainee Self-Evaluation Form to their supervisors at least one week prior to the Mid Placement Review meeting.

of Science","assoc_class_translated":"Program","assoc_duration_hb_display":"","assoc_current_version":{},"links":[]}],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"PSYC7400 - Interventions in Forensic Psychology 1","description":"

This course takes a scientist-practitioner approach, linking conceptual models of the aetiology and maintenance of clinical disorders with empirically-supported clinical interventions. A strong emphasis will be placed on links between experimental psychology and clinical practice. 

","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"cb75a26bdbf99850eb6b147a3a96197a","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Intervention Plan","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"50","description":"

This assessment will require students to develop an intervention plan for one case, detailing the approach they would take for the initial assessment, including selection of assessment devices, the treatment approach they would be considering, and how they would evaluate progress and outcome.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"7675a26bdbf99850eb6b147a3a961971","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"8375a26bdbf99850eb6b147a3a961974","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"cf75a26bdbf99850eb6b147a3a961976","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"7675a26bdbf99850eb6b147a3a961963","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Written Final Examination","assessment_type":{"label":"Examination","value":"examination"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"50","description":"

The examination will include two parts: short answer questions and an intervention plan for one case. Both parts will cover all course lecture and reading material.

contentlets.description: This course takes a scientist-practitioner approach, linking conceptual models of the aetiology and maintenance of clinical disorders with empirically-supported clinical interventions. A strong emphasis will be placed on links between experimental psychology and clinical practice.
contentlets.title: Interventions in Forensic Psychology 1

Doctorate.","campus":"Sydney","study_level_single":{"label":"Postgraduate","value":"pgrd"},"code":"PSYC7401","attributes":[],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"PSYC7401 - Interventions in Forensic Psychology 2","description":"

The course provides theoretical knowledge and practical skills in adult and child clinical psychology. The focus is on etiology, assessment, diagnosis, case conceptualisation, and empirically supported treatment of the most common adult and child clinical problems. These problems will be considered within the individual’s relevant social context, including family, school, and peers. The course covers best practice guidelines and is guided by a scientist-practitioner approach.

","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"55f559bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a9619b5","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Podcast","assessment_type":{"label":"Presentation","value":"presentation"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"30","description":"

Students will pair up to create an educational and entertaining podcast on a specific childhood or adolescent disorder, in the format of an interview, and targeted at a lay public audience. Students must first gain approval on their selected topic from the course coordinator. Students are encouraged to be as creative as possible and to be inspired by existing popular podcasts. Students will submit to the Course Coordinator a finalised podcast recording that is no longer than 10 minutes, and is in in MP3 format.

Written feedback will be provided within 10 working days.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"1df559bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a9619ae","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"59f559bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a9619b1","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"91f559bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a9619a9","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"ddf559bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a9619ab","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"49f559bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a961996","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Written case intervention plan","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"40","description":"

Students will prepare one written case intervention plan. This will require students to plan an assessment and intervention for a child and/or family, in the context of the relevant literature and in consideration of ethical and practice issues.

Written feedback will be provided within 10 working days.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"1df559bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a9619ae","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"59f559bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a9619b1","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"91f559bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a9619a9","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"ddf559bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a9619ab","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"81f559bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a96199b","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Assessment tool presentation","assessment_type":{"label":"Presentation","value":"presentation"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"30","description":"

Students will present on a single assessment tool/measure for assessing a specific childhood emotional or behavioural problem, including but not limited to the Child Behavior Checklist (CBCL), Conners, Multidimensional Anxiety Scale for Children (MASC), Children’s Depression Inventory (CDI), Spence Children’s Anxiety Scale, Inventory of Callous-Unemotional Traits (ICU), and Eyberg Child Behavior Inventory (ECBI)/ Sutter-Eyberg Student Behavior Inventory (SESBI-R). Presentations must be no longer than 10 minutes in length. Students will be required to contribute to a measures database in Excel that details key features of the assessment tool (e.g., construct designed to be measured, age range, reporter, number of items, time to complete, psychometric properties, etc.).

Written feedback will be provided within 10 working days.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"1df559bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a9619ae","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"59f559bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a9619b1","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"91f559bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a9619a9","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"ddf559bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a9619ab","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"c9f559bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a96199f","links":[]}]}],"inactive_course_alert":null,"timetableURL":"http://timetable.unsw.edu.au/2021/PSYC7401.html","subject_sample_text_staticcontent":"To access course outline, please visit:","links":[]}

","erg":[],"campus":{"name":""}},"additional_information":"","study_level_tooltip":"Postgraduate: A level of study that leads to the award of a Graduate Certificate, Graduate Diploma, Masters Degree or Doctorate.","campus":"Sydney","study_level_single":{"label":"Postgraduate","value":"pgrd"},"code":"PSYC7402","attributes":[],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"PSYC7402 - Applications of Forensic Psychology","description":"

This course is designed to assist students to develop skills in critical analysis, research design & communication, and the provision of feedback. The readings provide students with a broad overview of the scope and form of research conducted within the field of forensic psychology.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"266ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961918","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Brief Research Proposal","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"25","description":"

From weeks 1 to 6 students will be working on developing and refining a brief research proposal for any one of the course topics covered in the first six weeks. This research proposal is of the same format as those required from applicants for the National Medical Health Research Councils (NHMRC) Post-graduate, Post-doctoral and Early Career Researcher Fellowship funding schemes. The research proposals are to be no more than 10 000 characters (including everything; use Word Count in Word, check characters WITH spaces) and should include the following: project title; aims; background; proposed research methodology; significance of the proposal; and where appropriate, relevance to the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander population.  In Week 1, students will review 3 example BRPs and the marking rubric so they can familiarize themselves with the task and the performance expectations. Students are then required to send a draft of their proposal to all other class members and tutors for peer-review. Those who do not distribute their draft by the relevant deadline will be penalised 50% of their mark for this assessment.  Time will then be spent in class reviewing the submitted sections and providing feedback. This gives an opportunity for students to practice writing BRPs as well as giving and receiving feedback. The complete BRP is due 5pm Friday Week 7.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"266ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961909","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"2a6ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961914","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"626ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96190c","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"926b65b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619e5","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"9a6ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961903","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"ae6ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96190e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"d66ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961906","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"de6b65b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619e7","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"ea6ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961911","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"026b65b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619ce","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"In Class-Critiques","assessment_type":{"label":"Tutorial work","value":"tutorial_work"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"15","description":"

In order to develop skills in: 1. Critical analysis; 2. Research design & communication; and 3. Giving and receiving feedback, students are expected to be: a) developing and displaying their knowledge by actively participating in critical and considered discussion of required readings, b) developing and presenting research proposals, c) giving feedback to their peers, c) receiving and responding to feedback from staff and peers.  Accordingly, each week student participation in relation to the required readings will be assessed. During Weeks 1-6 students will be expected to practice giving and receiving feedback to their peers in relation to the BRP draft sections submitted for class review. The verbal feedback provided peers in class will be assessed and forms a central component of the class participation assessment. Course staff will provide feedback in various ways including verbal and written feedback on the elements of class participation. Students are required to compile all written feedback they received from the course teaching team (MN-H & MS) during the semester and provide a brief reflection on what the feedback says and what you have learned. (The specific form of the reflection will not be assessed, it is more important to reflect on what the feedback has meant). Due before 5pm Friday Week 10. Student responses to feedback as well as the amount and quality of class participation and feedback they have provided to their peers will be considered when determining marks for this assessment.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"266ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961909","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"2a6ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961914","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"626ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96190c","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"926b65b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619e5","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"9a6ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961903","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"ae6ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96190e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"d66ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961906","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"de6b65b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619e7","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"ea6ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961911","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"4a6b65b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619d2","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Presentation","assessment_type":{"label":"Presentation","value":"presentation"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"10","description":"

Each week (Weeks 8-10) three or five students will present a paper on the same broad topic as identified in the required reading (10 min - timed). Ideally, the paper will be have been published after the class reading and is intended to either provide an update on the topic, or highlight some innovation or controversy in the field. Students should provide a brief overview of the paper in presentation format, but focus on what it contributes to the field. Students will not be permitted to present on the same article. Students presenting in the same week should discuss their selection of articles with each other to avoid overlap.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"266ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961909","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"2a6ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961914","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"626ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96190c","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"926b65b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619e5","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"9a6ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961903","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"ae6ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96190e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"d66ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961906","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"de6b65b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619e7","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"ea6ba5b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961911","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"826b65b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619d7","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Grant Application","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"4","weighting":"50","description":"

Students are required to submit a research grant application (6 pages, 12pt font). The application should propose a research project on a topic to be announced in class during Week 5.  The Forensic Psychology Research Fund is a hypothetical research fund which seeks to fund policy relevant research in the broad arena of forensic psychology. The grant application must include the following: (1) completed application form, and (2) supporting material (literature review; research, aims and methodology; significance and expected outcomes). Further information will be provided.

This course involves an in-depth study of selected topics from the field of Psychology and law that have been subjected to rigorous experimental study. Classes will be delivered by lecturers with expertise on substantive topics in experimental psychology and law. The course particularly focuses on the design of research in Psychology-law, on the relationship between research and policy and on attempts to use research to inform changes to public policy and law.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"cfd3c1a7db807890fe4b322af496198b","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":"Individual","value":"Individual"},"assessment_name":"Report 1","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"40","description":"

This report must be based on the topics in the first half of the course. Students select the report topic from a list of alternatives. The topics specify a particular applied question and target audience for the report. Students are required to undertake a search for evidence relevant to the topic question, and to critically evaluate and synthesise this research, and apply it to the practical question posed. Students must present their findings and conclusions in a manner which is suitable for the specified target audience. Reports must be a maximum of 3,500 words in length (including all text except for the references and any appendices). Students may be penalised if they exceed the maximum word count.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"c3d309a7db807890fe4b322af49619e7","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"c3d309a7db807890fe4b322af49619e8","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"cbd309a7db807890fe4b322af49619e7","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"87d309a7db807890fe4b322af49619ea","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":"Individual","value":"Individual"},"assessment_name":"Critical review of assigned reading 2","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"10","description":"

Prior to attending the classes every student should read the assigned materials. In addition, each week, two or three students will be assigned to prepare a critical review (1-2 pages) of the readings and lead the class in a discussion of these materials. Over the 10 weeks of the course each student will have this responsibility twice. The student must produce a one or two-page review of the reading they have been assigned. The review should contain a brief summary of the study outcomes, together with a more detailed consideration of the theoretical practical and methodological implications of the research. These reviews must be made available to all students and to the lecturer at the start of the relevant class. Students presenting the papers must also lead a class discussion about the significance of the work, its weaknesses and strengths and its practical implications for policy in the field.

Please visit WIL website for more information."}],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"PSYC7409 - Professional and Ethical Practice (Forensic) 1","description":"

Introductory training in psychological assessment, treatment skills and ethical practices as required in the professional context. This course is associated with the Readiness Module at the UNSW Forensic Psychology Clinic.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"b05ba1b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619a3","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Review","assessment_type":{"label":"Performance","value":"performance"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"40","description":"

Review (see below for preparation for Review*) – Agenda required. Written documents must be sent at least three business days prior to Review to gain feedback (ensure you add an agenda item regarding review of written documents if you want it during the meeting). All documentation to be sent electronically. Review must be booked by end of week 9 via Doodle Poll (if you cannot make the time you have indicated on the poll, you are responsible for finding another available timeslot or exchanging a timeslot with another student). Documentation includes:

  • Agenda (time marks for require criteria, feedback on documentation (if desired), identification of learning from video assignment, as well as other relevant queries about professional development placements)
  • Two original consent forms (for assessment and treatment). Must cover all aspects of informed consent as per APS code of conduct.
  • Presentation section for assessment role play
  • Scan of notes from assessment
  • Therapy session plan
  • FIT forms
  • Session Impact Grid (template provided)
  • Session summary from therapy role play (NOT a HOSRAPS, but should include relevant information and meet minimum criteria for record keeping)
  • Consent practice form (for sighting – will need to be completed by end of Psyc7410)

Assessment Video – Forensic assessment of a client at presentence who has been referred for an assessment of their general functioning. Conduct a thorough clinical interview (no testing). Criteria for agenda:

  • Informed consent,
  • asking open and closed ended questions,
  • validation,
  • listening skills,
  • following a thorough and appropriate interview structure

Therapy Video – First session of therapy, client is motivated to attend and in ‘action’ stage of change. Criteria for agenda includes:

  • informed consent,
  • administration of the ORS with description of ROM,
  • brief assessment/intro (the mini-A), including a FIDI where appropriate,
  • introduction to CBT,
  • explanation of homework,
  • summary of session, including administration and discussion of the SRS
  • scheduling.

Demonstrated skills include:

  • rapport building skills (common therapeutic factors),
  • Understanding of ROM
  • ability to communicate understanding of CBT, homework and to share that understanding with low functioning client or client without knowledge of CBT.

* Preparation for Review:  Each PEP course has video requirements for the Review, which involves organizing role plays with a PEP4 student who will be your ‘client’ – remember, this means that you will likely need to reciprocate and be their ‘client’ for their videos. Video your role plays (while doing role plays, please video both the ‘therapist/assessor’ and the ‘client’) ensuring that sound quality is adequate (if inadequate, then cannot assess the required skills). Ensure that you prepare your partner for their task (it generally does not work well to tell your ‘client’ to “wing it”). Provide (and ask for) feedback from your role play partner subsequent to the tasks.

Students must successfully complete Readiness Module in preparation for Orientation placement and submit all associated documentation and logs to placement coordinator. This is a course requirement; if the Readiness Module is deemed as an “unsuccessful completion”, the Program Director has the discretion to fail the student in the course and implement a remedial plan.  A second failure can result in termination of the student’s program.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"205ba1b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96196c","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"685ba1b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96199c","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"6c5ba1b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96196e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"a45ba1b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96199f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"a85ba1b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961971","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"e45ba1b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961974","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"505ba1b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96195e","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Skill development","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"4","weighting":"20","description":"

Ethics must be read by Ethics class (class 2) and questions prepared for classes 3-6 for relevant assessment sections. Mastery of online quizzes on various topics, available on Moodle in Week 1.  Skill development will also be assessed through classroom participation in role plays and debriefings at the end of class.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"205ba1b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96196c","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"685ba1b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96199c","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"a45ba1b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96199f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"a85ba1b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961971","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"e45ba1b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961974","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"585ba1b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961959","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Compulsory activity: Workshop and lecture attendance","assessment_type":{"label":"Attendance","value":"attendance"},"assessment_id":"6","weighting":"","description":"

Students must attend 80% of lectures and workshops ensure they are consistently working towards achieving the foundational graduate competencies required by the APAC Accreditation Standards.  These Accreditation Standards are incorporated in Program and Course Learning Outcomes.  Any absence must be accompanied by a medical certificate or other reason for absence.  

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"205ba1b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96196c","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"685ba1b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96199c","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"6c5ba1b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96196e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"a45ba1b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96199f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"a85ba1b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961971","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"e45ba1b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961974","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"585ba1b3dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961962","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Actuarial and Structured Professional Judgment Assessments & report writing","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"30","description":"

Actuarial and Structured Professional Judgment Assessment and Report Writing.  In conjunction with the workshops on assessment and report writing, students will choose one Actuarial/Structured Professional Judgment. Tests can be chosen through the test library at the UNSW Forensic Psychology Clinic (all tests subject to need by clinics). Students must choose unique tests from one and other – the process for choosing tests will be discussed in class. Students must develop a case and conduct the test. Additionally, students must provide a written section of the report (Results of Testing) that includes a description of the test, limitations and interpretation of the results found in administration, as well as the documentation utilized (e.g., test profiles, etc.). If using an SPJ, students must show evidence of consideration of confirming and discrepant information for risk factors.

contentlets.description: Introductory training in psychological assessment, treatment skills and ethical practices as required in the professional context. This course is associated with the Readiness Module at the UNSW Forensic Psychology Clinic.
contentlets.title: Professional and Ethical Practice (Forensic) 1

Please visit WIL website for more information."}],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"PSYC7411 - Professional and Ethical Practice (Forensic) 3","description":"

Continuation of training of psychological assessment and treatment skills and ethical practices required in the professional context. Attendance at lectures and workshops is required. This course is associated with the placement requirement of the program.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"779fa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961953","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"PEP log book","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"10","description":"

Notations of activities as well as reflections on learning through lectures and workshops as part of professional development.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"2b9fa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961941","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"3f9fa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96194c","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"679fa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961944","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"7b9fa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96194f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"a39fa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961947","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"ef9fa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961949","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"579f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619ec","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Attendance at lectures and workshops","assessment_type":{"label":"Attendance","value":"attendance"},"assessment_id":"4","weighting":"","description":"

Attendance at 80% of lectures/workshops is required.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"2b9fa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961941","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"3f9fa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96194c","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"679fa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961944","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"7b9fa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96194f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"a39fa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961947","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"ef9fa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961949","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"979f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619f5","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Review, assessment, therapy","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"50","description":"

This assessment integrates review, assessment and therapy aspects of forensic practice and has both individual and group aspects. The  review and assessment stages  are performed individually whereas the therapy component, when necessitated on a case-by-case basis, can include group-based psycho-educational sessions.  Review – Must bring in agenda. Written documents must be sent electronically at least 72 hours prior to meeting (business days) in order to gain feedback regarding the written assignments. Videos must be time marked with discussion questions. Ensure you add an agenda item regarding review of written documents if you want it during the meeting. Meeting must be booked by last week of classes through Doodlepoll. Assessment – Specialized assessment for treatment program suitability (client is a violent offender with moderate/high levels of psychopathy). Must show evidence of explanation for assessment, assessment of motivation for treatment, probability of treatment gain for client, barriers to treatment. Please ensure you fully brief your ‘client’ so that they can provide ‘fodder’ for your role play. Written documentation includes a written letter to the head of the violent offender program outlining your findings and recommendations. Ensure you identify alternative resources if client is unsuitable. Therapy – With group psycho-educational session each facilitator must show check in procedures, introduction of new skills, dealing with resistance within a group structure. Students will need to show both the notes from the task you are teaching as well as your critique of another student’s presentation.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"2b9fa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961941","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"3f9fa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96194c","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"679fa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961944","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"7b9fa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96194f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"a39fa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961947","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"ef9fa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961949","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"9f9f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619ce","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Skill development","assessment_type":{"label":"Performance","value":"performance"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"40","description":"

Students must provide materials for and demonstrate skill development in PEP3 activities.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"2b9fa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961941","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"3f9fa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96194c","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"679fa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961944","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"7b9fa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96194f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"a39fa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961947","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"ef9fa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961949","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"9f9f697fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619f0","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Placements","assessment_type":{"label":"Performance","value":"performance"},"assessment_id":"5","weighting":"","description":"

Students must successfully complete their third placement (external or advanced clinic) and submit all associated documentation and logs to placement coordinator. This is a course requirement; if a placement is marked as an “unsuccessful completion”, the Program Director has the discretion to fail the student in PEP3 and implement a remedial plan.  A second failure can result in termination of the student’s program.

Please visit WIL website for more information."}],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"PSYC7412 - Professional and Ethical Practice (Forensic) 4","description":"

Continuation of training of psychological assessment and treatment skills and ethical practices required in the professional context. Attendance at lectures and workshops is required.  This course is associated with the placement requirement of the program (if completing four placements).


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"68afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619ec","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Skill development","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"40","description":"

Students must demonstrate development of PEP4 skills through workshop participation.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"20afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619e6","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"24afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619b8","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"60afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619bb","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"6cafa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619e8","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"d4afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619b5","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"e0afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619e3","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"00afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619a3","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Attendance at lectures/workshops","assessment_type":{"label":"Attendance","value":"attendance"},"assessment_id":"5","weighting":"","description":"

Attendance at 80% of lectures/workshops is required.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"20afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619e6","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"24afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619b8","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"60afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619bb","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"6cafa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619e8","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"d4afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619b5","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"e0afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619e3","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"10afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619ac","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Placements","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"4","weighting":"","description":"

Students must have successfully completed all placements and submitted all associated documentation and logs to placement coordinator. This is a course requirement; if any placement is marked as ‘fail’ then the Program Director has the discretion to fail the student in PEP4 and implement a remedial plan.  A second failure would result in termination of the student’s program.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"20afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619e6","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"24afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619b8","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"60afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619bb","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"6cafa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619e8","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"d4afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619b5","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"e0afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619e3","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"18afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619a7","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Supervision, assessment, therapy","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"50","description":"

Supervision – Must bring in agenda.  Written documents must be sent at least 72 hours prior to supervision (business days) in order to gain feedback regarding the written assignments. Videos must be time marked with discussion questions.   Supervision must be booked by last week of classes through Doodle Poll.  Assessment - Assessment with male client with domestic violence conviction who denies assault of partner.  Collateral interview exists - partner has indicated long history of DV.  Solicitor has indicated client unlikely to be serving time.  Written component includes risk assessment of client, as well as treatment and supervision recommendations.  Do not utilize WFC report template. Therapy –Client is victim of domestic violence; motivated but holds multiple and clearly held cognitive distortions related to DV.  Client states therapy is over. Termination session – wrap up, recommendations, safety issues.  Must demonstrate aspects of above through video role play and provide written Treatment Summary Report (do not use WFC template).

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"20afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619e6","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"24afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619b8","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"60afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619bb","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"6cafa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619e8","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"d4afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619b5","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"e0afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619e3","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"8cafa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961999","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"PEP log book & evaluation","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"10","description":"

Students are required as part of PEP4 to provide an evaluation of the program – what worked, what didn’t – and any recommendations.  There is no format or length expectation.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"20afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619e6","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"24afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619b8","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"60afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619bb","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"6cafa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619e8","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"d4afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619b5","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"e0afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619e3","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"c4afa97fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96199e","links":[]}]}],"inactive_course_alert":null,"timetableURL":"http://timetable.unsw.edu.au/2021/PSYC7412.html","subject_sample_text_staticcontent":"To access course outline, please visit:","links":[]}

This course involves undertaking a research project under the supervision of a member of academic staff in the School of Psychology. Research projects may be carried out on any topic that is relevant to forensic psychology. Students are required to prepare a thesis in the form of a journal article. Refer to PART 3: Research Thesis of the Program Guide available on the School website at https://www.psy.unsw.edu.au/current-students/postgraduate-coursework/master-psychology-forensic.

At the end of the term, students are required to write a brief progress report which describes progress relative to the timeline contained in the approved proposal, and to note any significant changes to topic or methodology. This progress report must be approved by the supervisor and the Program Director before students can progress to PSYC7414 (or PSYC7415). If adequate progress is made on the thesis project, students will receive a grade of EC (Enrolment Continuing) for PSYC7413. The completed thesis is marked by two members of the School's academic staff. The supervisor is not involved in marking the thesis. Once the mark for PSYC7414 is confirmed in the subsequent semester, this mark will replace the EC grade allocated PSYC7413 (or PSYC7415).

This course involves undertaking a research project under the supervision of a member of academic staff in the School of Psychology. Research projects may be carried out on any topic that is relevant to forensic psychology. Students are required to prepare a thesis in the form of a journal article. Refer to PART 3: Research Thesis of the Program Guide available on the School website at https://www.psy.unsw.edu.au/current-students/postgraduate-coursework/master-psychology-forensic.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"5dd7217bdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96191b","name":"Independent research - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Research Thesis","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"100","description":"

Students must submit and pass a research thesis. This thesis constitutes 100% of the mark for this course. 

In order to pass PSYC7413 and progress to PSYC7414 (or PSYC7415), supervisors will be required to indicate that students have made adequate progress on their thesis project.

Students must draw up a research proposal, including an indicative timeline for the research. This proposal is presented to the Forensic Masters research panel for approval. At the end of the term, students are required to write a brief progress report which describes progress relative to the timeline contained in the approved proposal, and to note any significant changes to topic or methodology. This progress report must be approved by the supervisor and the Program Director before students can progress to PSYC7414 (or PSYC7415). If adequate progress is made on the thesis project, students will receive a grade of EC (Enrolment Continuing) for PSYC7413. The completed thesis is marked by two members of the School's academic staff. The supervisor is not involved in marking the thesis. Once the mark for PSYC7414 is confirmed in the subsequent semester, this mark will replace the EC grade allocated PSYC7413 (or PSYC7415).

","erg":[],"campus":{"name":""}},"additional_information":"","study_level_tooltip":"Postgraduate: A level of study that leads to the award of a Graduate Certificate, Graduate Diploma, Masters Degree or Doctorate.","campus":"Sydney","study_level_single":{"label":"Postgraduate","value":"pgrd"},"code":"PSYC7415","attributes":[],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"PSYC7415 - Research Thesis (Forensic)","description":"

This course involves undertaking a research project under the supervision of a member of academic staff in the School of Psychology. Research projects may be carried out on any topic that is relevant to forensic psychology. Students are required to prepare a thesis in the form of a journal article. Refer to PART 3: Research Thesis of the Program Guide available on the School website at https://www.psy.unsw.edu.au/current-students/postgraduate-coursework/master-psychology-forensic.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"56d7217bdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619c1","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Research Thesis","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"100","description":"

Students must submit and pass a 24 UOC research thesis which constitutes 100% of the mark for this course.

Where adequate progress is made on the thesis, as determined by the supervisor and Program Director, a grade of EC (Enrolment Continuing) will be applied as a holding grade for the course in the first, second, and/or third (where applicable*) instance they are enrolled.

The completed thesis is marked by two members of the School's academic staff. The supervisor is not involved in marking the thesis.

Once the mark for thesis is finalised, and added to the course for the final instance/s* the student is enrolled, this mark will be backfilled (replacing the EC grade) to all previous instances of the course.

* It is envisaged that a student will enrol in this course twice.  The first time during T2 and the second time during T3.

  • Students completing a Standard full-time load should enrol in PSYC7413 during T1 and PSYC7415 during T2 and T
  • Student completing the Extended Progression, should enrol in PSYC7413 during T1 and PSYC7415 during T2 and T3.

Review meeting with Course Convenor and/or Supervisors of student professional skill development and performance with their clients. Documentation required at meeting: agenda, client assessment notes, letter to clinical or administrative manager outlining your findings and any recommendations, written session summary and behaviour chain attachment.  Two therapy/role-play videos are required to assess skill development: 

Assessment Video - Suicide assessment (research and choose an evidence based suicide assessment tool that is normed for your particular client).  The suicide assessment can be a specific assessment (i.e., referral to assess suicidality), or come up within an assessment or therapy. Must show evidence of: informed consent, establishment of rapport (demonstration of common factors), ability to deal with client in crisis, focus on a specific task (i.e., assessing risk of suicide), & making a plan. 

Therapy Video – Ongoing client (whom you believed to have been in Action Stage of Change) has not completed homework from last session.  Must show evidence of: motivational interviewing strategies, behaviour chain of noncompliance, use of troubleshooting, re-evaluation of goals/homework (as appropriate), movement towards resolution of the issue.  

Verbal feedback from the Course Convenor and/or Supervisors will be provided to at the review meeting.  Written feedback will also be provided within 10 working days of the review meeting.

","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"d45a69ffdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961925","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"PEP log book","assessment_type":{"label":"Assignment","value":"assignment"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"10","description":"

Marks and feedback will be provided by the Course Convenor/Clinic Director to students within 10 working days of submission.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"105a69ffdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96190a","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"405a29ffdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619df","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"5c5a69ffdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96190c","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"985a69ffdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96190f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"9c5a69ffdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96191e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"c05a69ffdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961907","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"734a29ffdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619c0","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Skill development - Psychoeducational Groups","assessment_type":{"label":"Assignment","value":"assignment"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"40","description":"

Presentations and groups on agreed topics will be run in lectures on weeks 3-9. Students will engage in co-facilitation tasks as agreed upon in Week 1. Each set of co-facilitators will present on a particular topic for approximately 15 minutes, then prepare the ‘group’ for the module they will be facilitating (where they are in the group program, what skills they will have gained, the type of group, etc.). The group will run for the remainder of the class with one break for feedback.

On the date of the group/presentation, the following documentation is required from the presenters:

- Session preparation

Within one week of presentation/group, the following documentation is required:

- Summary of the session with notes on each group member’s participation

NOTE:  if you participate in more than one group, your mark will be averaged. The groups will be marked on a rubric with the following categories/skills:

  1. Provision of an overview;
  2. ‘Set up’ of the group by the co-facilitators;
  3. Awareness of group dynamics/co-facilitation skills; and
  4. Showed teaching skills and related activities.

Verbal feedback will be provided by colleagues and Course Convenor following the presentation.  Marks and written feedback will be provided by the Course Convenor/Clinic Director to students within 10 working days of submission.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"105a69ffdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96190a","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"405a29ffdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619df","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"5c5a69ffdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96190c","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"985a69ffdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96190f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"9c5a69ffdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96191e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"c05a69ffdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961907","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"d85a69ffdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961921","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"885a29ffdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619d5","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Review","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"50","description":"

Review meeting with Course Convenor and/or Supervisors of student professional skill development and performance. Documentation required at meeting: agenda, letter to the head of the violent offender program outlining your findings and recommendations, assessment notes, group session preparation, critique of another student’s presentation.  Two videos of therapy/role-play to be included:

Assessment Video – Specialised assessment for treatment program suitability (client is a violent offender with moderate/high levels of psychopathy). Must show evidence of:

  • explanation for assessment, 
  • consent for assessment
  • assessment of motivation for treatment, 
  • exploration of probability of treatment gain, 
  • barriers to treatment.

Therapy Video – Group psycho-educational session. Each facilitator must demonstrate:

  • check in, 
  • review of gained skills,
  • introduction of a new skill, 
  • dealing with resistance within a group structure. 

Verbal feedback from the Course Convenor and/or Supervisors will be provided to at the review meeting.  Written feedback will also be provided within 10 working days of the review meeting.
